str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To change, exchange, reconcile. From kata and allasso; to change mutually, i.e. to compound a difference.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular

str2: A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Waiting at table; in a wider sense: service, ministration. From diakonos; attendance; figuratively aid, service.
Reconciliation, restoration to favor. From katallasso; exchange, i.e. Restoration to favor.
